name: Number of Beautiful Integers in the Range
title: Number of Beautiful Integers in the Range
content:
You are given positive integers low, high, and k.

A number is beautiful if it meets both of the following conditions:

  • The count of even digits in the number is equal to the count of odd digits.
  • The number is divisible by k.

Return the number of beautiful integers in the range [low, high].

 

Example 1:

Input: low = 10, high = 20, k = 3
Output: 2
Explanation: There are 2 beautiful integers in the given range: [12,18]. 
- 12 is beautiful because it contains 1 odd digit and 1 even digit, and is divisible by k = 3.
- 18 is beautiful because it contains 1 odd digit and 1 even digit, and is divisible by k = 3.
Additionally we can see that:
- 16 is not beautiful because it is not divisible by k = 3.
- 15 is not beautiful because it does not contain equal counts even and odd digits.
It can be shown that there are only 2 beautiful integers in the given range.

Example 2:

Input: low = 1, high = 10, k = 1
Output: 1
Explanation: There is 1 beautiful integer in the given range: [10].
- 10 is beautiful because it contains 1 odd digit and 1 even digit, and is divisible by k = 1.
It can be shown that there is only 1 beautiful integer in the given range.

Example 3:

Input: low = 5, high = 5, k = 2
Output: 0
Explanation: There are 0 beautiful integers in the given range.
- 5 is not beautiful because it is not divisible by k = 2 and it does not contain equal even and odd digits.

 

Constraints:

  • 0 < low <= high <= 109
  • 0 < k <= 20

discussion_posts.name: shrthk
discussion_posts.content: A 6D DP is an unholy creation, the existence of which i was blissfully unaware of.

discussion_posts.name: neembu_mirch
discussion_posts.content: i think the brute force solution must be restricted from passing otherwise what is the point of keeping this problem hard

discussion_posts.name: A770192
discussion_posts.content:
It should be made upto 10^18 so that brute force solution cannot pass because range between 10^8 and 10^9 have odd number of digits and number of odd digits cannot be equal to number of even digits.
*Plz do upvote for the help*

discussion_posts.name: tanjul_sarathe
discussion_posts.content: It seems like easy but when you write code for this u got frustrated. i got TLE on 573/595\uD83E\uDD72\uD83E\uDD72\uD83E\uDD72\uD83E\uDD72\uD83E\uDD72

discussion_posts.name: aero_coder
discussion_posts.content: We can optimise the 6d dp to 5d dp by storing the difference of (even_count - even_count) instead of seperate even_count and odd_count.\n

discussion_posts.name: Maddy_10
discussion_posts.content: 595/595 testcases passed but still shows TLE\n

discussion_posts.name: SharpBritannia
discussion_posts.content: This is unnecessarily hard. 1.1m numbers on a single thread in 800ms is production worthy. I\'ve seen other solutions and there\'s no way any self respecting reviewer would accept any of those (6D int arrays with no docs) for anything remotely bound to any sort of maintainability guideline. You want faster results? Give me an IBM Mainframe with unpacked binary coded decimals.
